findings.description: Hardcoded gas amounts can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Presence of unused variables
findings.description: Unused variables are present in the contract.

findings.title: Right-To Left Override control character (U+202E)
findings.description: The Right-to-Left Override (RLO) Unicode character U+202E can manipulate the visual order of characters in a string, potentially leading to phishing attacks or other security issues.

findings.title: Typographical Error
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: DoS With Block Gas Limit
findings.description: The contract may be vulnerable to Denial of Service (DoS) attacks due to block gas limit.

findings.title: Arbitrary Jump with Function Type Variable
findings.description: A vulnerability where an arbitrary jump can occur due to a function type variable.

findings.title: Insufficient Gas Griefing
findings.description: The contract may allow an attacker to drain the gas of a user's transaction by repeatedly calling a function with insufficient gas.

findings.title: Incorrect Inheritance Order
findings.description: The inheritance order of contracts is incorrect, which can lead to unexpected behavior and security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Write to Arbitrary Storage Location
findings.description: Authorized addresses can write to arbitrary storage locations due to lack of access control.

findings.title: Requirement Violation
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Lack of Proper Signature Verification
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Missing Protection against Signature Replay Attacks
findings.description: The smart contract lacks protection against signature replay attacks.

findings.title: Weak Sources of Randomness from Chain Attributes
findings.description: The contract uses weak sources of randomness from chain attributes, which can make it predictable and vulnerable to attacks.

findings.title: Shadowing State Variables
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Incorrect Constructor Name
findings.description: The constructor of a contract has an incorrect name.

findings.title: Signature Malleability
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Block values as a proxy for time
findings.description: Using block values (e.g., block.number or block.timestamp) as a proxy for time can be insecure and may lead to unexpected behavior.

findings.title: Authorization through tx.origin
findings.description: The contract uses tx.origin to authorize transactions, which can lead to unauthorized access and manipulation.

findings.title: DoS with Failed Call
findings.description: N/A

findings.title: Delegate call to Untrusted Callee
findings.description: A delegate call is made to an untrusted callee, which can lead to unauthorized access or manipulation of sensitive data.

findings.title: Use of Deprecated Solidity Functions
findings.description: The contract uses deprecated Solidity functions which can lead to security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Uninitialized Storage Pointer
findings.description: The storage pointer has not been initialized, which can lead to unexpected behavior and potential security vulnerabilities.
